2023 年 9 月 24 日星期日 06:01:04 +0000每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks TED - TED.com TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 TED 会议上值得传播的想法泰德TED 是一个致力于传播值得传播的想法的非营利组织。在此视频中，您将看到 TED 演讲，这些演讲激发、激发和激发了一些世界领先的思想家和实干家的想象力，他们在 TED 会议、TEDx 活动和世界各地的合作伙伴活动的舞台上发表演讲。该播客还提供高清视频和纯音频格式。 zh知识共享：https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-nd/4.0/泰德contact@ted.com https://pl.tedcdn.com/rss_feed_images/ted_talks_main_podcast/video.png每日 TED 演讲（标清视频） https://www.ted.com/talks 144 144 科学技术娱乐设计 TED、TEDTalks、TED 演讲、灵感、创造力、技术演示、教育不非成人的
我们是最后一代——还是第一代可持续发展的一代？ |汉娜·里奇汉娜·里奇The word "sustainability" gets thrown around a lot these days. But what does it actually mean for humanity to be sustainable? Environmental data scientist Hannah Ritchie digs into the numbers behind human progress across centuries, unpacking why the conventional understanding of sustainability is misleading and showing how we can be the first generation of humans to actually achieve it.我们是最后一代——还是第一代可持续发展的一代？ |汉娜·里奇The word "sustainability" gets thrown around a lot these days. But what does it actually mean for humanity to be sustainable? Environmental data scientist Hannah Ritchie digs into the numbers behind human progress across centuries, unpacking why the conventional understanding of sustainability is misleading and showing how we can be the first generation of humans to actually achieve it. https://www.ted.com/talks/hannah_ritchie_are_we_the_last_ Generation_or_the_first_sustainable_one?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:117938 117938 Fri, 22 Sep 2023 14:54:42 +0000高等教育不00:13:33泰德
快时尚的简单解决方案|约瑟芬·菲利普斯约瑟芬·菲利普斯Your favorite pair of jeans -- the ones you refuse to throw out -- are actually a part of a global climate solution, says fashion entrepreneur Josephine Philips. When you value your existing clothes instead of chasing the latest trends, you help reduce waste and protect our planet for generations to come. Learn more about the impacts of what you wear -- and the incredible power of repairing your clothes. 快时尚的简单解决方案|约瑟芬·菲利普斯Your favorite pair of jeans -- the ones you refuse to throw out -- are actually a part of a global climate solution, says fashion entrepreneur Josephine Philips. When you value your existing clothes instead of chasing the latest trends, you help reduce waste and protect our planet for generations to come. Learn more about the impacts of what you wear -- and the incredible power of repairing your clothes. https://www.ted.com/talks/josephine_philips_the_simple_solution_to_fast_fashion?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:117687 117687 Thu, 21 Sep 2023 14:56:47 +0000高等教育不00:08:17泰德
成功提出想法的秘诀|玛尔·赫申森玛尔·赫申森Have a great idea but sure how to sell it? Investor and teacher Mar Hershenson has you covered. Whether it's sharing a new product with a client or vying for a promotion, these three steps will help you tell an irresistible story and get the "yes" you're looking for.成功提出想法的秘诀|玛尔·赫申森Have a great idea but sure how to sell it? 人工智能能否帮助解决气候危机？ |西姆斯·威瑟斯彭西姆斯·威瑟斯彭"AI can be a transformational tool in our fight against climate change," says Sims Witherspoon, a leader at the AI research lab Google DeepMind. Using wind power as her case study, she explains how powerful neural networks can help us better predict Earth's changing ecosystems and accelerate the breakthrough science needed to create a carbon-free energy supply.人工智能能否帮助解决气候危机？ |西姆斯·威瑟斯彭"AI can be a transformational tool in our fight against climate change," says Sims Witherspoon, a leader at the AI research lab Google DeepMind. Using wind power as her case study, she explains how powerful neural networks can help us better predict Earth's changing ecosystems and accelerate the breakthrough science needed to create a carbon-free energy supply. https://www.ted.com/talks/sims_witherspoon_can_ai_help_solve_the_climate_crisis?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:117255 117255 Wed, 20 Sep 2023 14:53:21 +0000高等教育不00:12:08泰德
如何增强可再生能源并为世界注入活力 |丽贝卡·科利尔丽贝卡·科利尔The power sector generates the electricity that sustains modern life -- but it's also the number one contributor to climate change. We need a swift and equitable shift to renewable energy, says 2023 Audacious Project grantee and ReNew2030 executive director Rebecca Collyer. In conversation with TED's David Biello, she introduces a new coalition of governments, businesses and communities that aims to drastically scale wind and solar capacity in the 30 highest-emitting countries. Learn more about their plan -- and why Collyer has hope for a greener, more equitable future. (This ambitious idea is part of the Audacious Project, TED's initiative to inspire and fund global change.)如何增强可再生能源并为世界注入活力 |丽贝卡·科利尔The power sector generates the electricity that sustains modern life -- but it's also the number one contributor to climate change. We need a swift and equitable shift to renewable energy, says 2023 Audacious Project grantee and ReNew2030 executive director Rebecca Collyer. In conversation with TED's David Biello, she introduces a new coalition of governments, businesses and communities that aims to drastically scale wind and solar capacity in the 30 highest-emitting countries. Learn more about their plan -- and why Collyer has hope for a greener, more equitable future. (This ambitious idea is part of the Audacious Project, TED's initiative to inspire and fund global change.) https://www.ted.com/talks/rebecca_collyer_how_to_supercharge_renewables_and_energize_the_world?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:117489 117489 Tue, 19 Sep 2023 14:57:38 +0000高等教育不00:06:17泰德
由太阳能和风能驱动的经济即将到来 |卡拉·康斯坦丁卡拉·康斯坦丁With some of the highest energy bills in Southeast Asia and extreme weather to match, the Philippines experiences the climate crisis -- and climate activism -- as a part of daily life. Clean energy advocate Kala Constantino highlights how people across the country are coming together to transform policies, power and the economy as the island nation maps out its green revolution.由太阳能和风能驱动的经济即将到来 |卡拉·康斯坦丁With some of the highest energy bills in Southeast Asia and extreme weather to match, the Philippines experiences the climate crisis -- and climate activism -- as a part of daily life. Clean energy advocate Kala Constantino highlights how people across the country are coming together to transform policies, power and the economy as the island nation maps out its green revolution. https://www.ted.com/talks/kala_constantino_an_economy_powered_by_sun_and_wind_it_s_almost_here?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:114659 114659 Mon, 18 Sep 2023 14:47:06 +0000高等教育不00:05:13泰德
美国气象员的极端天气报告|艾尔·罗克艾尔·罗克It's not just you: the weather is getting worse. And if there's one person who would know, it's "America's weatherman," Al Roker, who's spent decades reporting live from some of the worst storms and natural disasters in history. He explains how we can each take action to address climate change and work towards a more sustainable, hopeful future for generations to come.美国气象员的极端天气报告|艾尔·罗克It's not just you: the weather is getting worse. And if there's one person who would know, it's "America's weatherman," Al Roker, who's spent decades reporting live from some of the worst storms and natural disasters in history. He explains how we can each take action to address climate change and work towards a more sustainable, hopeful future for generations to come. https://www.ted.com/talks/al_roker_an_extreme_weather_report_from_america_s_weatherman?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:117583 117583 Fri, 15 Sep 2023 11:26:47 +0000高等教育不00:10:06泰德
如何解决世界上最大的问题|娜塔莉·卡吉尔娜塔莉·卡吉尔Sometimes the world's biggest issues can seem so intractable that meaningful change feels impossible. But what if the answer has been right in front of us all along? What if the answer is actually throwing money at the problems? In this thought-provoking talk, philanthropic advisor Natalie Cargill shares what might happen if we came together to spend 3.5 trillion dollars on fixing the world. And, yes, she also has a plan for where to get the money from. (Followed by a Q&A with Anna Verghese, executive director of The Audacious Project.)如何解决世界上最大的问题|娜塔莉·卡吉尔Sometimes the world's biggest issues can seem so intractable that meaningful change feels impossible. 美国和中国能否共同应对气候变化？ |吴昌华吴昌华Climate change doesn't care about ideological divides, says policy analyst and China expert Changhua Wu. Here's what she says the US can learn from the progress China has made on the clean energy revolution -- and why collaboration instead of competition is the key to avoiding climate catastrophe.美国和中国能否共同应对气候变化？ |吴昌华Climate change doesn't care about ideological divides, says policy analyst and China expert Changhua Wu. 最重要的单一养育策略|贝基·肯尼迪贝基·肯尼迪Everyone loses their temper from time to time — but the stakes are dizzyingly high when the focus of your fury is your own child. Clinical psychologist and renowned parenting whisperer Becky Kennedy is here to help. Not only does she have practical advice to help parents manage the guilt and shame of their not-so-great moments but she also models the types of conversations you can have to be a better parent. (Hint: this works in all other relationships too.) Bottom line? It's never too late to reconnect.最重要的单一养育策略|贝基·肯尼迪Everyone loses their temper from time to time — but the stakes are dizzyingly high when the focus of your fury is your own child. Clinical psychologist and renowned parenting whisperer Becky Kennedy is here to help. (Hint: this works in all other relationships too.) Bottom line? It's never too late to reconnect. https://www.ted.com/talks/becky_kennedy_the_single_most_important_parenting_strategy?rss en.video.talk.ted.com:116355 116355 Wed, 13 Sep 2023 11:46:35 +0000高等教育不00:14:00泰德
鸟不是真的吗？阴谋如何腾飞|彼得·麦金多彼得·麦金多Peter McIndoe isn't a fan of birds. In fact, he has a theory about them that might shock you. Listen along to this eye-opening talk as it takes a turn and makes a larger point about conspiracies, truth and belonging in divisive times.鸟不是真的吗？阴谋如何腾飞|彼得·麦金多Peter McIndoe isn't a fan of birds.
